comment.author: 72133717@N05
comment._content: Details on www.cwgc.org :- Captain 10th Btn Canadian Infantry dies 22/4/1915 age 35 Comem on Ypres (Menin Gate) Memorial, Panel 24-28-30 Son of Mrs and the Late Henry Wallace of Canada, husband of Winifred Laura Jane Wallace of 87 Heene Road, Worthing, Sussex, England. In the Boer War 1899-1902 he served as Pte 3198 in the 14 Company (Northumberland) 5 Battalion Imperial Yeomanry and was awarded the Queen's South Africa Medal with clasps Cape Colony, Orange Free State, Transvaal, South Africa 1901 In the 1881 Census he is recorded as living at Trench Hall, Lamesley, Chester-le-Street with his parents Henry & Jessie Wallace and 3 sisters. His father was Land Agent to Lord Ravensworth.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: The Canadian Great War Project website has some basic service details for Captain Wallace: www.canadiangreatwarproject.com/searches/soldierDetail.as... Captain Wallace appears in the 1891 and 1891 censuses at Lamesley with his parents Henry Atholl Wallace and Jessie Ellis. He had 3 older sisters and by 1891 a further 3 siblings. He married Winifred Laura Jane Archer circa 1902 in Gateshead, Durham and by 1906 they were living in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada where they had been since 1902 according to the census record, so presumably straight after marrying. No children are shown on the 1906 census and Winifred's age is given as 22 (she was born in 1881 in Gateshead), with Henry's shown as 26.

comment.author: 22129269@N03
comment._content: He and Winifred had two children, Harold and Dorothy.
